Package org.uma.evolver.parameter.catalogue.createinitialsolutionsparameter

Class CreateInitialSolutionsParameter<S extends org.uma.jmetal.solution.Solution<?>>

java.lang.Object
org.uma.evolver.parameter.Parameter<String>
org.uma.evolver.parameter.type.CategoricalParameter
org.uma.evolver.parameter.catalogue.createinitialsolutionsparameter.CreateInitialSolutionsParameter<S>
Type Parameters:
S - The type of solutions being created
Direct Known Subclasses:
CreateInitialSolutionsBinaryParameter, CreateInitialSolutionsDoubleParameter, CreateInitialSolutionsPermutationParameter
public abstract class CreateInitialSolutionsParameter<S extends org.uma.jmetal.solution.Solution<?>> extends CategoricalParameter
An abstract categorical parameter for creating initial solutions in evolutionary algorithms. This parameter defines the strategy used to generate the initial population.

Implementations of this class should provide specific strategies for creating initial solutions based on the problem type (e.g., binary, double, permutation).

  • Method Details

    • getCreateInitialSolutionsStrategy

      public abstract org.uma.jmetal.component.catalogue.common.solutionscreation.SolutionsCreation<S> getCreateInitialSolutionsStrategy(org.uma.jmetal.problem.Problem<S> problem, int populationSize)
      Creates and returns a SolutionsCreation strategy based on the current parameter value. The specific implementation is provided by concrete subclasses.
      Parameters:
      problem - The problem for which to create initial solutions
      populationSize - The number of solutions to create
      Returns:
      A configured SolutionsCreation strategy
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if problem is null or populationSize is not positive
